legalTaxOptimisation: Claim Capital Allowances: Deduct the cost of qualifying assets (e.g., machinery, vehicles, furniture) from your taxable profit over time, reducing your final income tax.
Maximise Allowable Expenses: Ensure all legitimate, wholly, exclusively, necessarily, and reasonably incurred business expenses are meticulously documented and claimed to reduce taxable profit.
Utilise Withholding Tax (WHT) Credits: Offset your final income tax liability with WHT that has been deducted at source from payments made to your company throughout the year.
Explore Investment Incentives: Investigate eligibility for tax holidays like the Pioneer Status Incentive (PSI) or other sector-specific allowances if your business operates in a qualifying industry.
complianceNotes: VAT: File returns and remit payment monthly, by the 21st of the following month. CIT: File annual returns within 6 months of your financial year-end; provisional tax is due at the time of filing. Penalties and interest apply for late filings and payments. Record Keeping: You are legally required to maintain all business and accounting records for at least six years. Payment Difficulties: You can formally apply to the FIRS for a payment-in-instalments plan if you are unable to pay the full liability at once.
